thread.title: NFL: Cam Heyward honors late dad - Football
thread.title_full: NFL: Cam Heyward honors late dad - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS |
title: NFL: Cam Heyward honors late dad - Football
text:
PITTSBURGH — Cam Heyward is more concerned about paying tribute to his late father, Craig "Ironhead" Heyward of Passaic High School fame, and those battling cancer, than whatever fine the NFL might throw his way. 
Cam Heyward, the Pittsburgh Steelers defensive end, wore eye black with "Ironhead" written on it for the second straight week during Sunday’s 25-13 win over Arizona to honor his dad, who died after a long fight with cancer in 2006. The NFL hit Cam Heyward with a $5,787 fine for displaying the personal message.
Heyward said he’ll continue to pay the fine, adding he doesn’t "want to ruffle any feathers, but this is bigger than all we play for. There are people fighting for [their] lives."
After his dominance at Passaic during the early ’80s, Craig Heyward went on to a standout career at Pitt and with four NFL teams during an 11 year career.
